source: Machine Intelligence (MI) (DAT5, AAL-SW5, DV5, CS-IT7) [E22-44360]_ Purpose, content and evaluation - E22 _ Upgrade Moodle.md

details:
| Module title and ECTS credits                                 | Machine Intelligence (MI), 5 ECTS                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       |
 |---------------------------------------------------------------|-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
 | Module coordinator                                            | Alvaro Torralba (alto@cs.aau.dk)                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        |
 | Type and language                                             | Course and in English                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   |
 | Objectives                                                    | The aim of the course is to give the students an introduction to machine intelligence, focusing on terminology, concepts and the basic techniques which form the foundation for modern and more advanced machine intelligence systems                                                                                                                                                                                                   |
 | Academic content and conjunction with other modules/semesters | The academic content of the course includes constraint satisfaction problems, Bayesian networks (as a framework for knowledge representation and for reasoning under uncertainty) , planning (model-based sequential decision making) as well as machine learning techniques for classification and clustering. The content of the course supports the machine intelligence component of both of the elective projects on the semester. |
 | Scope and expected performance                                | It should be stressed that AAU expects each student to spend 28 hours of study per ECTS credit, amounting to 140 hours                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  |
 | Participants                                                  | DAT5, AAL-SW5, DV5, CS-IT7                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |
 | Preprequisites for participation                              |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |
 | Module activities (course sessions etc.)                      | The course consists of a series of lectures and exercises                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               |
 | Examination                                                   | Written examination                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     |
